definition: to suffer (defeat, death etc)
miserable/wretched/cruel/inhuman/disastrous/tragic/dim/gloomy
to meet by chance (usually with misfortune)/classifier for events: time, turn, incident
to meet with disaster/to die tragically

sentences.english: Many prisoners were tortured and were victims of gruesome medical experiments.
sentences.chinese: 许多囚犯惨遭蹂躏，成为了可怕的医学实验的受害者。

sentences.english: With desolation shall the earth be laid waste, and it shall be utterly spoiled: for the Lord hath spoken this word.
sentences.chinese: 大地必要完全荒废，惨遭浩劫，因为上主这样定了。

sentences.english: Eventually fall joinville city, the people were massacred in the city, the Ming army on the sidelines is not saved.
sentences.chinese: 最终晋州城陷落，城内百姓惨遭屠杀，明军旁观不救。

sentences.english: Not all malls have suffered from competition and the suburbs’ transformation.
sentences.chinese: 竞争和郊区的变革并没有让所有的商城都惨遭不幸。

sentences.english: Many civilians were killed in the attack on the town.
sentences.chinese: 在那次攻城中，许多平民惨遭杀害。

sentences.english: But then they dwindled and were humbled through oppression, sorrow and distress.
sentences.chinese: 其后因惨遭灾患苦难，人口减少而被弃如前。

sentences.english: Many innocent blacks were slain and their homes sacked.
sentences.chinese: 许多无辜的黑人惨遭杀害，他们的家也被洗劫一空。

sentences.english: What kind of national security do we have when were robbed of our leaders?
sentences.chinese: 当我们的领袖惨遭横祸还会有什么样的国家安全？

sentences.english: Others blamed the careful doe for leading him to the slaughter.
sentences.chinese: 还有些树仙责怪那只母鹿害他惨遭屠杀。

sentences.english: The child's misery would move even the most obdurate heart.
sentences.chinese: 这个孩子的悲惨遭遇即使最冷酷的心肠也会为之动情。

sentences.english: On the other hand, relatively few people have had badexperiences with Apple.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，相对较少的人在使用苹果时惨遭不测。

sentences.english: Dr Manette realized that the sister must have been very badly treated.
sentences.chinese: 曼奈特医生意识到这位姐姐准是惨遭虐待。

sentences.english: What was Job's understanding of God after all his miseries?
sentences.chinese: 约伯在这一切悲惨遭遇之后对上帝有何看法？

sentences.english: He told me a tale of woe about himself.
sentences.chinese: 他告诉了我一个关于他自己的悲惨遭遇。

sentences.english: Wars have been waged. Innocents have been slaughtered.
sentences.chinese: 为此曾经战火连天，无辜民众惨遭屠杀。

sentences.english: A remote village in Kaohsiung was feared fully sudmerged by flood-created lake burst.
sentences.chinese: 高雄县甲仙乡小林村甚至有恐全村惨遭灭顶。

definition: to meet by chance (usually with misfortune)/classifier for events: time, turn, incident
to suffer/to meet with (sth unfortunate)
to meet with/to encounter/(bitter) experience
to suffer the painful loss of (a loved one etc)/to miss out on (an opportunity)/to fail to gain (victory etc)
no match for/cannot beat
to meet with disaster/to die tragically

quilt/by/(indicates passive-voice clauses)/(literary) to cover/to meet with/(coll.) (since c. 2009) used before a verb that does not accurately represent what actually happened, to describe with black humor how sb or sth was dealt with by the authorities (as in 被自殺|被自杀[bei4 zi4 sha1])
Waterloo (Belgium)/Battle of Waterloo (1815)/fig. a defeat/failure
blood purge/massacre
to kill (or assault) sadistically
to sink down to/to be reduced to (sth inferior)
to hang sb up and beat him
spectacle too horrible to endure (idiom); tragic sight/appalling scenes of devastation
to suffer/to sustain (loss, misfortune)
to nurse a grievance/to harbor a grudge
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
